greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = 0 if n is 1 or a prime, otherwise, when n = A020639(n) * A032742(n), a(n) = the largest k < A032742(n) such that either k = 1 or A020639(k) >= A020639(n), where A020639(n) and A032742(n) are the smallest prime and the largest proper divisor dividing n.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
formula: a(k) = 1 if and only if k is one of A001248 (squares of primes).
program: (Scheme) (define (A249738 n) (cond ((or (= 1 n) (prime? n)) 0) (else (let ((lpf (A020639 n))) (let loop ((k (- (A032742 n) 1))) (cond ((= 1 k) k) ((>= (A020639 k) lpf) k) (else (loop (- k 1)))))))))
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Dec 06 2014
